docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: INTERNATIONAL A2-7 The maverick of Soviet politics, Boris N. Yeltsin, announced he was quitting the Communist Party, dealing a sharp new blow to the once-monolithic force even as it struggled to stay united. Page A1
docs.snippet: LEAD:    INTERNATIONAL    A2-7       The maverick of Soviet politics, Boris N. Yeltsin, announced he was quitting the Communist Party, dealing a sharp new blow to the once-monolithic force even as it struggled to stay united.    Page A1

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Amos E. Neyhart, an expert on automobile safety who originated driver education programs in the United States in the 1930's, died on July 5 at the Fairways Nursing Home in State College, Pa. He was 91 years old.

headline.main: Amos Neyhart, 91; Originated Courses In Driver Education

docs.snippet: LEAD: Amos E. Neyhart, an expert on automobile safety who originated driver education programs in the United States in the 1930's, died on July 5 at the Fairways Nursing Home in State College, Pa. He was 91 years old.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Like many parents who cannot afford health insurance for their children, Edith M. Harris has known the guilt of delaying her sons' vaccinations and treating their fevers with compresses rather than antibiotics.

headline.main: New York Health Care: A Big Step For Children

docs.snippet: LEAD: Like many parents who cannot afford health insurance for their children, Edith M. Harris has known the guilt of delaying her sons' vaccinations and treating their fevers with compresses rather than antibiotics.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: In a flurry of last-minute activity during the final days of its 213th Session, the New York State Legislature approved measures to create a children's health insurance program, to cap the fees that doctors may charge the elderly and to pump $420 million into New York's hospital system.

headline.main: Summary of Action in New York Legislature's 213th Session
